question:
In Budget 2018, the government announced a new scheme “Revitalising Infrastructure and Systems in Education (RISE)”. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. RISE will serve as a new funding model for the central universities and other higher education institutes
  2. The scheme will be financed via a restructured Higher Education Financing Agency (HEFA)
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. In Budget 2018, government announced a new scheme called “Revitalising Infrastructure and Systems in Education (RISE)”. Under the new funding model, the central universities and other higher education institutes will be able to borrow up to Rs 1Lakh crore in the next four years. <u>Second statement is correct</u> because the RISE scheme will be financed via a restructured Higher Education Financing Agency (HEFA). Currently, HEFA is functioning for as a non-banking financial company. In Budget 2018, HEFA was allocated Rs 250 crore and for FY19, the proposed budget for HEFA is Rs 2,750 crore.
